name: cascade
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small waterfall, often one of a group
trans_examp.trans_cn: 小瀑布（常指瀑布群的分支）

trans_examp.trans_en: a large amount of something that hangs down

example.eg: A cascade of golden hair fell down his back.
example.egtrans: 金发如瀑布般披散在他的肩头。

name: cascade
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: cascade
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fall quickly and in large amounts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 如瀑布般下落；大量倾泻

example.eg: Coins cascaded from/out of the fruit machine.
example.egtrans: 大量硬币从吃角子老虎机中倾泻而出。

dsense.name: cascade
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pass on information by giving it to just a few people, who then give it to more people; to be passed on in this way

example.eg: Guest information is cascaded through employee shift briefings.
example.egtrans: 客人信息是在员工轮班简报时传达的。

example.eg: Communication cascades down the organization until the information has been communicated through each level, to the front lines.
example.egtrans: 整个组织逐级沟通，直到信息通过各阶层传达到一线员工。
